GR14vaimp__u:171: 5.1.16.6 ye vyoma-bhūmy-agni[*32]-jalasya vāyos saṃyoga-bhūtāḥ praruhanti sarve tān daivike śuddhi-karāya bījān nirvapāmi deva-sthiti-kāraṇāya
GR14vaimp__u:172: [*30] 1946 edition shows the incorrect reading pamṛddhaiḥ which was corrected in the 1984 edition. In Telegu script, pa and sa are very similar.
GR14vaimp__u:173_0: [*31] 1946 text reads martyānṃ. The 1984 text reads martyān, assuming that what appears
GR14vaimp__u:173_1: to be a second r is actually a symbol for final n with one loop broken off. Otherwise
GR14vaimp__u:173_2: as it stands, the 1984 edition would read
GR14vaimp__u:174: marrtyā. I have corrected all these unintelligible forms to martyānāṃ,
GR14vaimp__u:175: which combined with annena provides an intelligible reading parallel to haviṣā surāṇān.
GR14vaimp__u:176: [*32] The text places an anudatta under the ū of bhūmy and then a svarita over the a in agni, seemingly an impossible feat of recitation.

GR14vaimp__u:203: [*34] I read this as dharā sā yā. In his English translation of the KJK,
GR14vaimp__u:204: Goudriaan (p. 319) lists an alternative reading dhārāyāsāya from a group of manuscripts which he calls L. Goudriaan is unable to translate these
GR14vaimp__u:205: letters either as dhārāsāyā (which he incorrectly lists as dhārāsāya) or as dhārāyāsāya.
GR14vaimp__u:206: [*35] I have added visarga to correct the text.
GR14vaimp__u:207: [*36] The 1946 edition correctly gives jyeṣṭhā, however the 1984 edition has corrupted the word to jeṣṭhā.
GR14vaimp__u:208: [*37] The older edition correctly gives puṇya-, however the 1984 edition of the text has corrupted it to ṛuṇya-. In Telegu script, p and ṛ, when following a consonant, are similar.
GR14vaimp__u:209: [*38] The text gives the unintelligible vareḷām, which I have changed to vareśām, to the (female) lord of boons. I chose this over the possible
GR14vaimp__u:210: vareṣām since in the Telegu script ḷ is very similar to ś. Also the reading of vareśām gives provides a referent for the four occurrences in
GR14vaimp__u:212: [*39] I have corrected śvaśrāvaye to śvaḥ śrāvaye. Thus the word śvaḥ,
GR14vaimp__u:213: “tomorrow” follows the word adya, “today” in the previous line, a common sequence. cf. RV 6.56.6d.

GR14vaimp__u:430: [*62] The 1984 Telegu script edition of the VMP has accidentally put pages
GR14vaimp__u:431: 17 and 18 of the first praśna after page 16 of the fifth praśna. Similarly page 17 and 18 of the fifth praśna has been put after page 16 of the first
GR14vaimp__u:432_0: praśna. The first four praśnas form a single book and praśnas 5-8 form the second
GR14vaimp__u:432_1: book. Therefore the text begins numbering again from 1 at the beginning of praśna
GR14vaimp__u:432_2: 5, and this is why the two sets of pages 17 and 18

GR14vaimp__u:1141: [*216] AŚ sādhu [*217] The AŚ here gives amum iti svan nāmādiśeta.

GR14vaimp__u:1147: [*224] Beginning with the words tad adya in VMP 5.1.149.8 and ending here
GR14vaimp__u:1148_0: with the word juṣadhvaṃ a complete verse from RV 10.53.4 is quoted. In the VMP text,
GR14vaimp__u:1148_1: the verse is divided between two sections. The third line of this verse, ūrjāda...juṣadhvam,
GR14vaimp__u:1148_2: is the first line of section 150, however the numbering has been adjusted so that
GR14vaimp__u:1148_3: the complete verse is at the end
GR14vaimp__u:1149: of section 149. AŚ 1.2.1 includes only a pratīka from RV 10.53.4, however VMP includes the entire RV verse.

GR14vaimp__u:1160: [*226] RV, TB, MS, etc: sumnayuḥ; The VMP here begins a pattern of dropping the last vowel (and any consonant that follows it) from the last
GR14vaimp__u:1161: word in an RV quote and adding om at the end. This is seen to continue through 5.1.152.4.

GR14vaimp__u:1199: [*246] Beginning with this verse and ending with verse 5.1.154.1, āvaha devān yajamānāya, is a set of pratīkas which are found in TS 2.5.9.1-4.
GR14vaimp__u:1200_0: The complete verse is as follows (I have underlined the Sanskrit and English that
GR14vaimp__u:1200_1: appears in the VMP text): agne mahāṅ asīty āha mahān hy eṣa yad agnir brāhmaṇety
GR14vaimp__u:1200_2: āha brāhmaṇo hy eṣa bhāratety āhaiṣa hi devebhyo
GR14vaimp__u:1201_0: havyaṃ bharati deveddha ity āha devā hy etam aindhate manviddha ity āha manur hy
GR14vaimp__u:1201_1: etam uttaro devebhya aindharṣi-ṣṭuta ity āharṣayo hy etam astuvan viprānumadita ity
GR14vaimp__u:1201_2: āha (1) viprā hy ete yac chuśruvāṃso brahma-saṃśita ity āha brahma-saṃśito hy eṣa
GR14vaimp__u:1201_3: ghṛtahavana ity āha ghṛtāhutir hy asya priyatamā
GR14vaimp__u:1202_0: praṇīr yajñānām ity āha praṇīr hy eṣa yajñānāṃ rathīr adhvarāṇām ity āhaiṣa hi deva-ratho
GR14vaimp__u:1202_1: 'tūrto hotety āha na hy etaṃ kaścana (2) tarati tūrṇir havya-vāḍ ity āha sarvaṃ hy
GR14vaimp__u:1202_2: eṣa taraty āspātraṃ juhūr devānām ity āha juhūr hy eṣa devānāṃ camaso deva-pāna ity
GR14vaimp__u:1203: 'rāṃ ivāgne nemir devāṃs tvaṃ paribhūr asīty āha devān hy eṣa paribhūr yad
GR14vaimp__u:1204: brūyād ā vaha devān devayate yajamānāyeti bhrātṛvyam asmai (3) janayed ā vaha devān yajamānāyety āha yajamānam evaitena vardhayati... |
GR14vaimp__u:1206: translation: “`O Agni, thou art great', he says, for Agni is great. `O
GR14vaimp__u:1207: Brahman', he says, for he is a Brahman. `O Bhārata', he says, for he bears
GR14vaimp__u:1208: the sacrifice to the gods. `Kindled by the gods', he says, for the gods
GR14vaimp__u:1209: kindled him. `Kindled by Manu', he says, for Manu kindled him after the
GR14vaimp__u:1210: gods. `Praised by the Ṛṣis', he says, for the Ṛṣis praised him. `Rejoiced
GR14vaimp__u:1211: in by sages', he says, for learned people are sages. `Celebrated by the poets', he says, for learned people are the poets. `Quickened by the holy
GR14vaimp__u:1212_0: power (Brahman)', he says, for he is quickened by the holy power (Brahman). `With
GR14vaimp__u:1212_1: ghee offering', he says, for ghee is his dearest offering. `Leader of the sacrifices',
GR14vaimp__u:1212_2: he says, for he is the leader of the
GR14vaimp__u:1213: sacrifices. `Charioteer of the rites', he says, for he is the chariot of
GR14vaimp__u:1214: the gods. `The Hotṛ unsurpassed', he says, for no one surpasses him.
GR14vaimp__u:1215: `Surpassing, bearing the oblation', he says, for he surpasses all. `The
GR14vaimp__u:1216: mouth dish, the ladle of the gods', he says, for he is the ladle of the
GR14vaimp__u:1217_0: gods. `The bowl from which the gods drink', he says, for he is the bowl from which
GR14vaimp__u:1217_1: the gods drink. `O Agni, like a felly the spokes, thou dost surround the gods', he
GR14vaimp__u:1217_2: says, for he surrounds the gods. If he were to say,
GR14vaimp__u:1218_0: `Bring hither the gods to the pious sacrificer', he would produce an enemy for him.
GR14vaimp__u:1218_1: `Bring hither the gods to the sacrificer', he says; verily with that he makes the
GR14vaimp__u:1219: [*247] This verse is in parentheses in the Sanskrit text.

GR14vaimp__u:4363: 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ 8.1.205.4 āpo hi ṣṭhā mayo-bhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana mahe raṇāya cakṣase
GR14vaimp__u:4364: 8.1.205.5 yo vaś śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ uśatīr iva mātaraḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4365: 8.1.205.6 tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha āpo janayathā ca naḥ[*958]
GR14vaimp__u:4366: [*958] VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of
GR14vaimp__u:4367: chapter 206. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes at the end of chapter
GR14vaimp__u:4368: 8.1.206.1 pṛthivī śāntā sāgninā śāntā sā me śāntā śuca(g)ṃ śamayatu
GR14vaimp__u:4369: antarikṣa(g)ṃ śāntaṃ tad vāyunā śāntaṃ tan me śānta(g)ṃ śuca(g)ṃ śamayatu
GR14vaimp__u:4370: 8.1.206.2 dyauś śāntā sādityena śāntā sā me śāntā śuca(g)ṃ śamayatu
GR14vaimp__u:4371: 8.1.206.3 pṛthivī śāntir antarikṣa(g)ṃ śāntir dyauś śāntir
GR14vaimp__u:4372: 8.1.206.4 diśaś śāntir avāntara-diśāś śāntir agniś śāntir vāyuś śāntir ādityaś śāntiś candramāś śāntir nakṣatrāṇi śāntir
GR14vaimp__u:4373: 8.1.206.5 āpaś śāntir oṣadhayaś śāntir vanas-patayaś śāntir
GR14vaimp__u:4374: 8.1.206.6 gauś śāntir ajā śāntir aśvaś śāntiḥ puruṣaś śāntir brahmā śāntir brāhmanaś śāntiś śāntir eva śāntiś śāntir me astu śāntiḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4375: 8.1.206.7 tayāha(g)ṃ śāntyā sarva-śāntyā mahyaṃ dvi-pade catuṣ-pade ca śāntiṃ karomi śāntir me astu śāntiḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4376: 8.1.206.8 eha śrīś ca hrīś ca dhṛtiś ca tapo medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyaṃ dharmaś caitāni mottiṣṭhantam anūttiṣṭhantu mā mā(g)ṃ śrīś ca hrīś
GR14vaimp__u:4377: ca dhṛtiś ca tapo medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyaṃ dharmaś caitāni mā mā
GR14vaimp__u:4379: 8.1.206.9 udāyuṣā svāyuṣod oṣadhīnā(g)ṃ rasenotparjanyasya śuṣmeṇodasthām amṛtā(g)ṃ anu
GR14vaimp__u:4380_0: 8.1.206.10 tac cakṣur deva-hitaṃ purastāc[*959] chukram uccarat paśyema śaradaś śataṃ
GR14vaimp__u:4380_1: jīvema śaradaś śataṃ nandāma śaradaś śataṃ modāma śaradaś śataṃ bhavāma śaradaś śata(g)ṃ
GR14vaimp__u:4380_2: śṛṇavāma śaradaś śataṃ prabravāma śaradaś śatam ajītās syāma śaradaś śataṃ jyok ca
GR14vaimp__u:4380_3: sūryaṃ dṛśe 8.1.206.11 ya udagān mahato 'rṇavād vibhrājamānas sarirasya madhyāth
GR14vaimp__u:4380_4: sa mā vṛṣabho lohitākṣas sūryo vipaścin manasā punātu
GR14vaimp__u:4381: 8.1.206.12 brahmaṇaś ścotany[*960] asi brahmaṇa āṇī stho brahmaṇa āvapanam
GR14vaimp__u:4382: asi dhāriteyaṃ pṛthivī brahmaṇā mahī dhāritam enena mahad antarikṣaṃ divaṃ dādhāra pṛthivī(g)ṃ sa-devāṃ yad ahaṃ veda tad ahaṃ dhārayāṇi mā mad vedo
GR14vaimp__u:4385: sarvam āyur ayāṇi sarvam āyur ayāṇi
GR14vaimp__u:4386: 8.1.206.14 ābhir gīrbhir yad ato na ūnam āpyāyaya harivo vardhamānaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4387: yadā stotṛbhyo mahi gotrā rujāsi bhūyiṣṭha-bhājo adha te syāma
GR14vaimp__u:4388: 8.1.206.15 brahma prāvādiṣma tan no mā hāsīt
GR14vaimp__u:4391: 8.0.37 parāvato dadhātu baddhāñ jinvatha dṛśe sapta ca
GR14vaimp__u:4392: 8.0.38[*961] tam eka-nemim ud vayan tamasa dhārāsu saptāgniś śuci-vratatamaś śuciḥ pra tad viṣṇur bhūḥ prapadye tejovat syāvas savitur
GR14vaimp__u:4393: agnim īḷe trir deva viṣṇor nu kam āśāsu saptasu vāstoṣ-pate śucī vo havyodyantaṃ vā hiraṇya-garbhas sam avartatendraṃ vo 'gne naya āyātu deva
GR14vaimp__u:4394: namas sute 'stabhnād yā pīvonnā madbhyas tirodhāstu[*962] hi śrutaṃ kanikradad īṅ-kārāyā-go-dānād omāsa rātrī vyakhyad āyatī hiraṇya-garbha
GR14vaimp__u:4395: viśva-jite viṣṇave svāhā nārāyaṇāya namo brahmaṇe tac chaṃ yor namo vāce śaṃ no mitraś śaṃ no vātaḥ pavatā(g)ṃ sapta-tri(g)ṃśat
GR14vaimp__u:4397_0: 8.0.39[*963] tam eka-nemiṃ śaṅkhaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi pūtaḥ pūtāntar bali rakṣakāy[]āgniś
GR14vaimp__u:4397_1: śuci-vratatama yo vā saṃyoga idaṃ viṣṇus tejovat syāvas savitur devasya tvā viṣṇor
GR14vaimp__u:4397_2: nu kaṃ citran devānā(g)ṃ śaṃ no devī
GR14vaimp__u:4398: raktāmbara-dharam āvāhayāmi nārāyaṇāyodyantaṃ vā tri-kadrukebhir ā vo rājā
GR14vaimp__u:4399: notthitāya svāhā viśva-jite nārāyaṇāya śaṃ no mitra(g)ṃ ṣaḍ
GR14vaimp__u:4401: tam eka-nemin tri-vṛta(g)ṃ ṣoḍaśāntam oṃ śāntiś śāntiś śāntiḥ hariḥ oṃ tatth sat śrī kṛṣnārpaṇam astu
